definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Accounting is an important specialized fundamental course for the non-financial accounting profession compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 會計學是非財會專業必修的重要專業基礎課。

sentences.english: At least 10 years post-qualification experience in both external audit acing in commercial environment.
sentences.chinese: 至少10年外部審計及公司財會的工作經驗。

sentences.english: To establish accounting model room is best way in which theory combines with practice.
sentences.chinese: 建立財會模擬室是實現理論聯繫實際的最佳途徑。

sentences.english: Mary, here is our financial department.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗，這裏是我們的財會部。

sentences.english: Vicky Yang, 30, is an actuary at an accounting firm in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 30歲，在北京的一家財會公司做精算師。

sentences.english: All in favor of outsourcing accounting and web maintenance please raise your hand.
sentences.chinese: 最後三人舉手表決，同意將財會和網站管理業務外包。

sentences.english: Liberal arts majors are considered inferior to graduates with engineering or accounting degrees.
sentences.chinese: 文科生被認爲不如擁有工程或財會學位的畢業生。

sentences.english: Let me introduce the people in our department.
sentences.chinese: 請讓我介紹財會部人員。

sentences.english: You must submit an invoice to the accounting department if you want your money.
sentences.chinese: 你如果想領到錢，必須交給財會部門一張工資申請單。

sentences.english: Homework cost information to provide need higher levels of accounting personnel.
sentences.chinese: 作業成本信息的提供需要較高水平的財會人員。

definition: lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4
Bei3 jing1 Di4 er4 Wai4 guo2 yu3 Xue2 yuan4

definition: to give classes/to work as a teacher
trader or dealer (of stocks and shares etc)
